poem:
### Standing at the Crossroads

In the glow of a screen,  
they debate the color of freedom,  
balancing words on a wire,  
while the shadows of algorithms lurk,  
waiting to pounce on the unaware.  
A dance between light and dark,  
where ministers, like hesitant dancers,  
must decide whose footsteps  
will trace the path of our digital futures.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The Guardian view on online safety: ministers must stand up to big tech | Editorial No one, not even its biggest supporters, thought that last year’s Online Safety Act was perfect. Finding a balance between free expression and digital access on the one hand, and the prevention of various kinds of harm on the other, was a hugely challenging task. The resulting legislation has been criticised as confused. But it was an important first step". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
